attributes.action: take the first step towards rehabilitation of the party and  legalise the House of Commons by removing all of the scottish constituency MPs who have no right to be sitting there - including himself.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Following yesterdays Henley-on-Thames by-election, Nu-Labour is dead as an effective political party and one of the main reasons for this is the dissatisfaction of the electorate over the issue of scottish constituency MPs (who are Gordon Brown's 'keep me in power' Nu-Labour sycophants) having a vote on purely England matters while english constituency MPs have no vote on purely Scotland matters.  These interlopers must be removed forthwith - perhaps at the time he stands down from being Prime Minister (which MUST be soon) he can take a wider step and go back to Scotland with the 40 or so others.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
